title: Forward
text:
For this graph, I took the Part of Body compared to the Total Amount of Injuries for the positions of Forward








From this, we can takeaway that forwards experience more lower body thigh and knee injuries.They also experienced lesser amounts of lower body hamstring and ankle injuries.

title: Home
text:
The Premier League is located in England and is one of the most competetive leagues out of all the soccer leagues. There are 20 teams in the Premier League, and I analyzed the positions and ages of all the players in the Premier League who suffered from an injury in the 2022/2023 season. Using data from Footystats, I found out that the positions that generate the most injuries are Defenders and Midfielders mainly in the lower body. Also, most injuries happen between the ages of 20 and 30

This is one of my main plots that you can find on the injuries page with further explanation

title: Goalkeeper
text:
For this graph, I took the Part of Body compared to the Total Amount of Injuries for the position of Goalkeeper








From this, we can takeaway that goalkeepers experience more lower body thigh injuries.

title: About
text: My name is Zayan Farooq, and I am a current freshman at Walter Payton College Prep. My areas of interest are Computer Science, Physics, French, and Math. My hobbies are soccer, rock climbing, painting and drawing, and creating and building different things.

title: About
text:
Positions

Goalkeeper
1 goalie


Defense:
Four Defenders: Left Defense, Center Left Defense, Center Right Defense, and Right Defense


Midfield:
Three Midfielders: Left Mid, Center Mid, and Right Mid


Forward
Three Offenders: Left Wing, Striker, and Right Wing

title: Age
text:
Soccer injuries may vary depending on the age of the player. The following data was used with the tidyverse, plotly, and ggplot2 packages. Then I selected the age and injury column to figure out if there is a relationship between injuries and age in the Premier League. This was then used to visualize injuries compared to age in an inuitive format that clearly shows the relationship between the two variables.





This data clearly shows that most injuries happen between the mid 20’s and low 30’s. This could be because young players under the age of 20 have less confidence to play more aggressive in games. Additionally, older players get weaker and slower as they age above 30.

title: Defender
text:
For this graph, I took the Part of Body compared to the Total Amount of Injuries for the positions of Defender








From this, we can takeaway that defenders experience more lower body thigh injuries. They also experienced lesser amounts of upper body head injuries.

title: Injuries
text:
Soccer injuries may vary depending on the position. The following data was used with the tidyverse, plotly, and ggplot2 packages. Then, I selected the important data columns to analyze the relationship between position and injuries in the Premier League. This was then used to visualize positions compared to injuries in an inuitive format that clearly shows the relationship. I did this by putting the positions from the beginning to end of field, and the injuries from toes to heads on the body.
Note that in both of the following plots:
Other injuries are illness or tiredness (Plot 1)
Other_body is anywhere on the body where the player feels ill or tired (Plot 2)
Also, these plots are interactive so if the reader hovers above each of the points, they can see the players injury, position, and club.




Injury Plot 1 (Specific)
This plot shows all the types of injuries compared to position, with position at the x axis, and injuries at the y axis. Then, I color coded the dots to represent the current club that the player is on.
Note: “Other” injuries are illness or tiredness






From this, we can takeaway that:
There are more thigh injuries in defending
There are more knee injuries in the forward position
There are more thigh injuries in goalkeeping
There are more thigh injuries in the midfielding position


Injury Plot 2 (Broad)
This is a more broad scatterplot of the one above. Instead of each injury being listed, I have grouped them by the region of body where the injury has happened.
Note: “Other_body” is anywhere on the body where the player feels ill or tired






From this, we can takeaway that there are more lower body injuries for all of the positions

title: Midfielder
text:
For this graph, I took the Part of Body compared to the Total Amount of Injuries for the positions of Midfielder








From this, we can takeaway that midfielders experience more lower body thigh and knee injuries.They also experienced lesser amounts of upper body hand,lower back, and chest injuries
